title: Is it safe to turn your children into YouTube stars?
text: Is it safe to turn your children into YouTube stars? Wednesday, 16 September 2015 (17 minutes ago) The rise of family vlogging has seen new mums and dads turn the lives of their kids into an online spectacle. But can they be sure this isn’t harming them? By now, you know Zoella. When you hear the word “vlogger”, her squeaky-clean, baby-faced brand is exactly what comes to mind. But vloggers are varied. Older, rounder ... This Blue Light in Your Device Can Kill Eye Cells 00:54 the blue light powering new devices including phones, tables and monitors are so bright they can damage your eyes. . Many of the displays we all use today use blue light frequencies of between 415 and 455 nanometers. Tests have shown that such light can kill cells in our retinas causing damage to our...
